SEARCH
Package risk.common.persistence

Klasse CountryInitiator

java.lang.Object
risk.common.persistence.CountryInitiator
public class CountryInitiator extends Object
Initializes and manages the loading and organization of countries and their neighboring relationships from a data file.

This class is responsible for reading country and neighbor data from a specified file, parsing the information, and organizing it into a usable structure for the game. It provides methods to initialize countries with their neighbors and continents with countries, ensuring that the game's geographical data is accurately represented and accessible.

    Constructs a new CountryInitiator instance for initializing and managing countries and their neighbors.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • CountryInitiator

      public CountryInitiator(String filePath)
      Constructs a new CountryInitiator instance for initializing and managing countries and their neighbors.

      This constructor initializes the countriesAndNeighbors map and starts the process of loading countries and their neighboring relationships from the specified data file. It serves as the entry point for preparing the game's geographical data.

      Parameter:
      filePath - The path to the file containing the countries and their neighbors. This file is expected to follow a specific format where each line represents a country followed by its neighbors, separated by commas.

  • Methodendetails

    • initializeCountries

      public List<Country> initializeCountries()
      Initializes all countries with their abbreviations and neighbors, and returns a list of all initialized countries.

      This method first creates all country objects from the countriesAndNeighbors map, where each country is initialized with its name and abbreviation. The abbreviation is assumed to be the first element in the list of neighbors. After all countries are created, the method iterates again over the countriesAndNeighbors map to set the neighbors for each country. Neighbors are added based on the remaining elements in the list for each country entry in the map.

      The method returns a list of all the country objects it has initialized, with each country having its neighbors properly set. This list can be used for further processing or initialization in the game.

      Gibt zurück:
      A list of Country objects, each initialized with a name, abbreviation, and a list of neighbors.

    • initializeContinents

      public List<Continent> initializeContinents(String filePath, List<Country> countries)
      Initializes continents with their respective bonus units and assigns countries to them based on a data file.

      This method reads from a specified file to create Continent objects, each with a name and bonus units. It then assigns countries to these continents based on the country names listed in the file for each continent. The countries must already be initialized and passed to this method in a list. This setup is crucial for accurately representing the game's geographical divisions and the strategic value of each continent.

      Parameter:
      filePath - The path to the file containing the continents, their bonus units, and the countries they contain. Each line in the file should start with the continent name, followed by the bonus units, and then the list of countries, all separated by commas.
      countries - A list of all Country objects previously initialized, which will be used to assign countries to their respective continents.
      Gibt zurück:
      A list of Continent objects, each initialized with a name, bonus units, and a list of countries belonging to it.

    • getCountryByName

      public Country getCountryByName(String countryName, List<Country> countries)
      Retrieves a Country object by its name from a list of countries.

      This method iterates through a given list of Country objects, comparing each country's name with the specified countryName. If a match is found, the corresponding Country object is returned. If no match is found, the method returns null, indicating that no country with the specified name exists in the list.

      Parameter:
      countryName - The name of the country to be retrieved.
      countries - A list of Country objects among which to search for the country.
      Gibt zurück:
      The Country object with the specified name, or null if no such country exists in the list.
